subject: Parenting
title: Praise That Helps vs Praise That Harms
description: A fast breakdown of Praise That Helps vs Praise That Harms for builders.

hook.text: 'You're so smart!' feels like a compliment. It's actually a trap.

buildup.text: Carol Dweck's research divided praise into two types: person praise and process praise.

discovery.text: 'You're smart' (person praise) makes children avoid challenges â€” failure would mean they're not smart.

twist.text: 'You worked hard on that' (process praise) makes children seek challenges â€” effort is something they control.

climax.text: One word changes everything: praising what children do instead of what they are builds resilience.

punchline.text: Praise the work, not the worker. It makes all the difference.

quiz.question: Why does telling a child 'you're so smart' backfire?
options: It makes them avoid challenges to protect their 'smart' identity
